title: Bachelor star Laura Byrne candidly discusses body confidence months after giving birth to Marlie-Mae
text:
She's The Bachelor beauty who welcomed her first child with fiancé Matthew 'Matty J' Johnson back in June.

And just months after giving birth, Laura Byrne has candidly opened up about how she feels about her post-baby body - as she posed up a storm for Next's clothing campaign in London.

'It can be hard to feel like yourself after having a baby,' she told Daily Mail Australia. 'Especially if you’re still breastfeeding and getting little sleep.'

Happy family! Laura Byrne (centre) posed up a storm in Next clothing, sporting an oversized knit jumper and gorgeous tan trousers. Pictured with fiancé Matty J (left) and the pair's daughter, Marlie-Mae

Laura then revealed the wardrobe staples she can't live without since becoming a first-time mum.

She continued: 'For me, it’s all about comfort and relaxed pieces that allow me to feed Marlie discreetly in public without feeling daggy.

'A quality fitted pair of denim jeans is a wardrobe staple. I love the straight leg style from Next. Chuck on an oversize T and I’m good to roll out the door.'

Beauty in blue! One of the shots showed Laura in a beautiful blue dress, which she teamed with some stylish white trainers

The happy couple were pictured in a series of gorgeous ensembles from the collection, with one snap showing Laura sporting a gorgeous over-sized jumper and tan trousers.

Another showed her in a beautiful flowing blue gown, while Matty kept things cool in a tan jumper and beige chinos.

The pair had jetted off to London for the shoot, flying a whopping 25 hours from Australia with their newborn daughter in tow.

Style icon: Another look saw Laura sporting a pair of denim jeans - which she describes as a 'wardrobe staple'

Loving life! Despite the classic English weather, the genetically blessed couple appeared in high spirits as they posed for photos in England's capital

Discussing the family holiday, Matty said: 'The awesome thing about travelling with an infant is that you create these really special memories that sort of time stamp life at that point.

'We will always be able to look back on this time and remember exactly where we were and what we were doing when Marlie-Mae was four months old - we were in London!'

He added: 'It’s crazy how quickly life can change in what seems like such a short period of time - I honestly couldn’t be happier.

'It was really surreal and very nostalgic being back in London, some of the friends I had left behind have also started families of their own so being able to catch up with them and share that part of my life with my girls was really special.'

Super stylish: Laura admits that her style is 'all about comfort and relaxed pieces'

authors: Nicole Douglas For Daily Mail Australia
